summary: Skyrim with Japanese voices and English subtitles.
descriptionHtml:
[size=6][b][font=Comic Sans MS][i][u][center]Skyrim Japanese Voices v.1[/center][/u][/i][/font][/b][/size][font=Verdana][center]===============================================================================================[/center][/font][font=Verdana][size=5][center]For those who wish to listen to Skyrim in Japanese while still having English subtitles.
Does not work with NMM.[/center][/size][/font][font=Verdana]===============================================================================================
[/font][font=Verdana]Installation.[/font][font=Verdana]WARNING - MAKE AN ENGLISH BACKUP FIRST.[/font][font=Verdana]Creating Backup.
[/font][font=Verdana]1. Make a new folder named 'Skyrim English Voices' or somthing similar
[/font][font=Verdana]2. Open your Skyrim Data folder found in Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim in your program files
[/font][font=Verdana]3A. Copy the files named 'Skyrim - Voices.bsa' 'Skyrim - VoicesExtra.bsa'
[/font][font=Verdana]3B. For those that have the DLCs, copy the 'Dawnguard.bsa' 'Dragonborn.bsa' and/or 'HearthFires.bsa' for the corresponding DLC
[/font][font=Verdana]4. Paste the .bsa files into your SEV folder
[/font][font=Verdana]----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[/font][font=Verdana]Installing/Uninstalling SJV.
[/font][font=Verdana]1. Extract SJV folder from archive to desktop
[/font][font=Verdana]2. Copy SJV .bsa files to you Skyrim Data folder and click 'Replace All'. [color=#ff0000][b][u]Do NOT Use theÂ 'Dawnguard.bsa' 'Dragonborn.bsa' and/or 'HearthFires.bsa' Files if you do not the relevant DLCs[/u][/b][/color]
[/font][font=Verdana]3. To uninstall repeat installation prossess with SEV .bsa files

For MO Users
1. Go into Mod Organizer and select "install a new mod from an archive." (The disc symbol in the top left corner.)
2. Navigate to your Japanese Skyrim Voices folder and add the archives to Mod Organizer. Put the Dawnguard.bsa after your dawnguard.esm, your Hearthfire.bsa after your Hearthfire.esm and your Dragornborn.bsa after your Dragonborn.esm.[b] [color=#ff0000][u]Ignore if you do not have the DLCs[/u][/color][/b]
3. Put the Skyrim - Voices.bsa and the Skyrim - VoicesExtra.bsa wherever you want them. They should be placed towards the bottom of your mod order so that they overwrite any conflicting mods. Activate all of the .bsa files.
Your Skyrim Dialogue should now be Japanese. If you want to change it back to English, simply turn off the Japanese .bsa mods
[/font][font=Verdana]===============================================================================================
[/font][font=Verdana]Bugs.
[/font][font=Verdana]1. Some of the dialog may be spoken in English
[/font][font=Verdana]2. Custom English voiced mods and followers are not affected and will still speak in English[/font][font=Verdana]3. Standalone followers using Skyrim voices will respond in Japanese when you talk to them, but use the English voices when commenting during battle or exploration[/font]
author: SirSidney
